page.title: 19Stewartry Agricultural Show
page.content: The Stewartry Show is held annually on the first Thursday in August in the market fields on the outskirts of Castle Douglas. There are classes for the various breeds of animals: cattle, sheep, horses, goats, dogs and poultry. Many local farmers show their best animals. Judges, invited from all over Scotland award prizes to the winners. Also on show are farm machinery, and other items of interest to the farming community. This show usually attracts a crowd in the region of 5,000, many of whom are holiday makers, however the majority are from the farming community who regard the show also as a social occasion.
